name: Healthyfied Garlic Egg Drop Bacon Soup
description: Indulge in a delicious bowl of Healthyfied Garlic Egg Drop Bacon Soup, a perfect blend of health and flavor. Tailored for those following a low-carb diet, this recipe combines the richness of bacon with the wholesome goodness of vegetables and a garlicky broth. It's not just a soup; it's a hearty meal that celebrates healthy eating without compromising taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your vegetables: Slice the carrots, chop the red bell pepper and green cabbage, mince the garlic, and finely chop the red onion.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, bring 6 cups of water to a boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sliced carrots, chopped red bell pepper, and chopped green cabbage to the boiling water. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: While the vegetables are cooking, cut the bacon into small pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: In a separate pan, cook the bacon pieces over medium heat until crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: In the same pan used for bacon, sauté the minced garlic and chopped red onion until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sautéed garlic and onion along with the crispy bacon to the pot of boiling vegetables.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the granulated garlic, then crack the egg into the soup. Gently stir the soup to create egg ribbons. Cook for an additional 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the pot from heat. Allow the soup to sit for a couple of minutes before serving to enhance the flavors.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9
